name: User Couldn't Call a Privileged Service 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess'
description: The 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess' function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA.
query: (winlog.channel:Security AND winlog.provider_name:/[Mm][Ii][Cc][Rr][Oo][Ss][Oo][Ff][Tt]\-[Ww][Ii][Nn][Dd][Oo][Ww][Ss]\-[Ss][Ee][Cc][Uu][Rr][Ii][Tt][Yy]\-[Aa][Uu][Dd][Ii][Tt][Ii][Nn][Gg]/ AND event.code:4673 AND winlog.event_data.Service:/[Ll][Ss][Aa][Rr][Ee][Gg][Ii][Ss][Tt][Ee][Rr][Ll][Oo][Gg][Oo][Nn][Pp][Rr][Oo][Cc][Ee][Ss][Ss]\(\)/ AND Keywords:/0[Xx]8010000000000000/)
note: **Detection Rule without Regex for better understanding. Be careful, this way is case sensitive:**`(winlog.channel:Security AND winlog.provider_name:Microsoft\-Windows\-Security\-Auditing AND event.code:4673 AND winlog.event_data.Service:LsaRegisterLogonProcess\(\) AND Keywords:0x8010000000000000)`
